passage: A Suspended Ordeal is a 1914 short comedy film directed by and starring Fatty Arbuckle. Fans of the film often compare it to Modern Times, a film starring Charlie Chaplin.

Time Runner (also known as In Exile) is a 1993 science fiction film starring Mark Hamill. Many sci-fi enthusiasts have drawn parallels between this film and The Matrix, praising both for their innovative storylines.
The Straight and Narrow is a 1918 American silent comedy film featuring Oliver Hardy. The film has a style reminiscent of the famous silent comedy Gold Rush by Charlie Chaplin.

Charam is a 1983 Malayalam thriller film directed by P. A. Backer and starring Prem Nazir, Vijayakumar, Meena Menon and Urmila. The film draws inspiration from international thrillers like Psycho directed by Alfred Hitchcock.
Garden of Heaven is a 2003 South Korean film starring Ahn Jae-wook and Lee Eun-ju. The film shares thematic similarities to the Hollywood film A Walk to Remember.
The Great American Broadcast is a 1941 comedy film directed by Archie Mayo. It stars Jack Oakie, Alice Faye and John Payne. Fans often compare this historic film to the modern comedy Anchorman.

Hollow Point is a 1996 film directed by Sidney J. Furie and starring Thomas Ian Griffith, Tia Carrere, John Lithgow, and Donald Sutherland. Griffith previously appeared in films such as xXx, known for its action sequences.
The Woman Who Believed is a 1922 American silent drama film, directed by Jack Harvey. The World and His Wife, where Walter Miller also starred, is another movie from the same era.
Short Orders is a 1923 film starring Stan Laurel. Fans of Stan Laurel would typically also go for The Finishing Touch, another movie with his remarkable performances.
Caminito alegre is a 1943 Mexican film. It stars Sara García and Isabela Corona, who was also captivating in Dark River.
Mamma Roma is a 1962 drama film written and directed by Pier Paolo Pasolini and starring Anna Magnani. Magnani is widely recognized for her work in The Rose Tattoo, another notable drama film.

Dust Be My Destiny is a drama film released in 1939. John Garfield stars as a man who gets into trouble after being sentenced to a work farm. Garfields performance in this film is often compared to his role in The Postman Always Rings Twice.

Boots Malone is a 1952 drama film starring William Holden as a down-on-his-luck sports agent and Johnny Stewart as a rich runaway who wants to become a jockey. Its a shift for Holden from his previous challenging role in Sunset Boulevard.
Marie-Chantal contre le docteur Kha, also known as Blue Panther, is a 1965 spy film directed by Claude Chabrol. This film follows the thematic thread of bibs previous work Les Biches.

Cat and Dog (Italian: Cane e gatto, also known as Thieves and Robbers and Cats and Dogs) is a 1983 Italian comedy film directed by Bruno Corbucci. Corbuccis prevailing comic vision can also be seen in his super hit The Inspector.
The Brothers Solomon is a 2007 American comedy film, starring Will Arnett and Will Forte. Will Arnett has also given award-winning performances in Arrested Development.

Dharma Devathai is a 1986 Tamil-language Indian feature film directed by SP. Muthuraman for AVM Productions, starring Vijayakanth. Fans of Vijayakanth may also know him from his memorable performance in Captain Prabhakaran.

Voyagers! is an American science fiction television series about time travel that aired on NBC during the 1982–1983 season. The series stars Jon-Erik Hexum and Meeno Peluce. Fans of Hexum would also appreciate his work in Cover Up.
Luke, the Gladiator is a 1916 short comedy film starring Harold Lloyd. The silent film enthusiasts may also appreciate The Freshman, another comedy masterpiece of Harold Lloyd.
100 Ways to Murder Your Wife is a 1986 Hong Kong comedy film directed by Kenny Bee and starring Bee. You might also enjoy Gardens of Stone, another one of Bees notable movies.
Riding Shotgun is a 1954 western film directed by André De Toth, starring Randolph Scott, Wayne Morris and Joan Weldon. Scott was also known for his work in Seven Men from Now.
Singapore Woman is a 1941 film directed by Jean Negulesco. It stars Brenda Marshall and David Bruce. The Constant Nymph is another film that features the acting talents of Brenda Marshall.
Shadow in the Sky is a 1952 film drama starring Ralph Meeker. If youre a fan of Meeker, you might also like his work in Kiss Me Deadly.

Women Who Work (Spanish: Mujeres que trabajan) is a 1938 Argentine comedy film directed by Manuel Romero. The film includes Tito Lusiardo, also known for his performances in musical comedy film Tango Bar.
Varaphalam is a 1994 Malayalam comedy film directed by Thaha and starring Sreenivasan and Mukesh in the lead roles. Sreenivasans comedic style can also be appreciated in Sandhesam.

Sri Raja Rajeshwari (also Sree Raja Rajeshwari) is a 2001 Tamil religious film directed by Bharati Kannan and starring Ramya Krishna, Ramki, Sangavi, and Banupriya. Ramya Krishna is also noted for her work in Baahubali: The Beginning.
Jolson Sings Again is the 1949 film sequel to The Jolson Story, both of which cover the life of singer Al Jolson. If youre a fan of Jolson, you might also enjoy his performance in The Jazz Singer.

The Daredevil Men is a 1972 British short subject detailing the activities of stunt performers and stunt arrangers featuring Tom Adams. Adams is also well-known for his role in the television series The First Men in the Moon.
entity: The First Men in the Moon

passage: Émilie Caen is a French actress. She is known for playing the role of Ségolène in Serial (Bad) Weddings. Another work showcasing her acting skills includes Superchondriac.

American Venus is a 2007 Canadian drama film directed by Bruce Sweeney and starring Rebecca De Mornay, Jane McGregor and Matt Craven. If you enjoyed this film, you might also like The Hand That Rocks the Cradle which features De Mornay.
entity: The Hand That Rocks the Cradle

passage: Manathe Vellitheru is a 1994 Malayalam-language Indian feature film directed by Fazil, starring Vineeth, Shobana, Mukesh, Lakshmi, Sanup Kumar and Sreenivasan. Followers of Vineeth might also appreciate his performance in Pranayavarnangal.

Subhodayam is a 1980 Telugu film directed by K. Viswanath. It is remade in Hindi language as Kaamchor in 1982 starring Rakesh Roshan and Jaya Prada. In Bollywood, Rakesh Roshan is also known for prominent roles in films like Khoobsurat.
The Thief of Bagdad (Italian: Il Ladro di Bagdad) is a 1961 film starring Steve Reeves. If youre a fan of Reeves, you might also enjoy Hercules Unchained, another film where he starred.
The Essential Bugs Bunny is a DVD set featuring cartoons focusing on Bugs Bunny. It was released on November 4, 2010. Another collection featuring Bugs Bunny includes Looney Tunes: Golden Collection.

Edward Anthony (August 4, 1895 – August 16, 1971) was an American journalist and writer who co-wrote Frank Buck’s first two books, Bring Em Back Alive, and Wild Cargo. If you enjoy Bucks adventures, you may also like his work in Fang and Claw.

JLG/JLG – Self-Portrait in December (French: JLG/JLG - autoportrait de décembre) is a 1995 French documentary film directed by Jean-Luc Godard. For more of Godards work, Breathless is another famous film of his.

Carbide and Sorrel (German: Karbid und Sauerampfer) is a 1963 East German comedy film directed by Frank Beyer and starring Erwin Geschonneck. Geschonneck also delivered an amazing performance in the film Jacob the Liar.
Careebeyans is a 2013 Indian Malayalam film, directed by Irshad and produced by Nanda Kumar. The film stars Kalabhavan Mani. Fans of Manis acting might also be familiar with his work in Ben Johnson.
Luke Foils the Villain is a 1916 American short comedy film starring Harold Lloyd. If you enjoy Lloyds comedic style, you might love Safety Last!, another one of his classic films.
Lovely, Still is a 2008 Christmas-themed romantic drama film starring Martin Landau and Ellen Burstyn. Fans of Martin Landau may also appreciate his performance in Crimes and Misdemeanors.
Magroor is a 1979 Bollywood film directed by Brij. It stars Shatrughan Sinha and Vidya Sinha. Shatrughan Sinha is also notable for his work in Kalicharan.
The Hayseed is a 1919 American short comedy film directed by and starring Fatty Arbuckle. For those who appreciate Arbuckles work, Coney Island is another one of his well-known films.
The Saddle Buster is a 1932 Western film starring Tom Keene. Fans of Keene might also enjoy his performance in Freighters of Destiny.

Wild Women is a 1918 American comedy western film directed by John Ford and featuring Harry Carey. The film is considered to be lost. Carey, however, had a vibrant cinematic career, also featuring in works like Trader Horn.
Absence of the Good is a 1999 film starring Stephen Baldwin and directed by John Flynn. For Baldwin fans, another feature you might enjoy is The Usual Suspects.

The Traitors is a 1962 British thriller film directed by Robert Tronson and starring Patrick Allen, Jacqueline Ellis, Zena Walker and James Maxwell. Patrick Allen also starred in the famous television series Crane.

Down River is a 1931 British crime film directed by Peter Godfrey and starring Charles Laughton, Jane Baxter and Harold Huth. Fans of Laughton might also appreciate him in the infamous Witness for the Prosecution.
Luke and the Bomb Throwers is a 1916 short comedy film starring Harold Lloyd. If you enjoy Lloyds comedic antics, Safety Last! is another must-watch.
The Glass Shield is a 1995 crime drama film starring Ice Cube, Michael Boatman and Lori Petty, directed by Charles Burnett. You might be familiar with Ice Cubes work in Boyz n the Hood as well.

I giorni più belli (Italian: The Best Days or The Most Beautiful Days) is a 1956 Italian comedy film directed by Mario Mattoli and starring Franco Interlenghi. You might also recognize Interlenghi from his performance in I Vitelloni.
Gumnaam – The Mystery is a 2008 Bollywood Hindi mystery film written and directed by Neeraj Pathak starring Dino Morea and Mahima Chaudhry in the lead roles. Another film featuring Morea is Raaz.

The House on Trubnaya (Russian: Дом на Трубной, translit. Dom na Trubnoy) is a 1928 comedy film directed by Boris Barnet and starring Vera Maretskaya. Another film featuring Maretskaya is The Woman Alone.
The Dignity of the Nobodies (Spanish: La dignidad de los nadies) is a 2005 Argentine documentary film directed by Fernando Solanas. For more works by Solanas, check out The Hour of the Furnaces.
Yeh Vaada Raha is a 1982 Hindi film starring Shammi Kapoor, Poonam Dhillon, Tina Munim and Rishi Kapoor. For more of Kapoors work, Junglee is another of his well-known films.

A Fight for Love was a 1919 American Western film directed by John Ford and featuring Harry Carey. The film is considered to be lost. If you want to see Carey in a movie thats not lost, you might want to check out The Last of the Clintons.
Anumanaspadam (Telugu: అనుమానాస్పదం) is a 2007 Telugu movie that is directed by Vamsi. Aryan Rajesh plays the lead role. The film released on 10 February 2007. Rajesh has also starred in Baladur.

Sankat City (Hindi: संकट सिटी) is a dark comedy Bollywood Hindi movie directed by Pankaj Advani starring Kay Kay Menon. The film was released in India on July 10, 2009. You might also be familiar with Menons work in Bombay Velvet.
Night Passage is a 1957 Western film starring James Stewart and Audie Murphy. If you are a fan of James Stewart, you might enjoy his performance in Vertigo.

Neend Hamari Khwab Tumhare is a 1966 Indian Bollywood film directed by Shiv Sahni and produced by Hans Choudhary. It stars Shashi Kapoor and Nanda in pivotal roles. Shashi Kapoor is also notable for his work in Deewaar.

The Hired Heart is a 1997 made-for-television film starring Penelope Ann Miller, Brett Cullen and Barry Corbin. It was directed by Jeremy Kagan and written by Jeff Elison. For more of Penelope Ann Millers work, The Artist is another fantastic film.

Pagadai Panirendu is a 1982 Tamil language Indian feature film directed by Dhamodharan N, starring Kamal Haasan, Sripriya and Y. G. Mahendra. For a different flavor of Kamal Haasans talent, check out Hey Ram.

Gogol Bordello Non-Stop is a 2008 music documentary film, written and directed by Margarita Jimeno and starring Gogol Bordello and Eugene Hütz. Another film featuring Gogol Bordello is Everything Is Illuminated.
Saath Saath is a 1982 Hindi language Movie directed by Raman Kumar and starring Farooque Shaikh and Deepti Naval in the lead roles. Farooque Shaikh also starred in the film Umrao Jaan.
9mm Sunrise is a 2006 action-adventure film that was directed by Scott Shaw. This films stars Scott Shaw and Conrad Brooks. Brooks also features in the film Plan 9 from Outer Space.
Drunkboat is a 2010 American drama-genre film starring John Malkovich, Dana Delany and John Goodman. You might also enjoy Malkovichs performances in the film Being John Malkovich.
Inside Monkey Zetterland is a 1992 independent film penned by former child actor Steve Antin. You can watch Antins acting skills in the film The Last American Virgin.

The Railroad Builder is a 1911 American silent short drama film. The film starred William Garwood, Marguerite Snow and William Russell. For those interested in more Marguerite Snow films, she also features in The Million Dollar Mystery.
The Weak-End Party is a 1922 film featuring Stan Laurel. Laurel is also known for his role in the classic film Sons of the Desert.

Derek Cecil (born January 5, 1973) is an American actor. He starred in the short-lived series Push, Nevada. He also made many appearances on the series Pasadena. Cecil also featured in the series House of Cards.
Shudhamaddalam is a 1993 Indian Malayalam film, directed by Thulasidas and starring Mukesh and Vijayakumar in lead roles. Mukesh also starred in the film In Harihar Nagar.
The Jackals of a Great City is a 1916 American silent drama film featuring Harry Carey. Carey also featured in the film Air Mail.
fact_list: The Jackals of a Great City

passage: Tyler Perrys A Madea Christmas may refer to:. Perry also starred in Boo! A Madea Halloween.
A Tender-Hearted Crook is a 1913 American drama film featuring Harry Carey. Another film featuring Carey is The Miracle Man.
Demonium is a 2001 horror film by German director Andreas Schnaas and stars Andrea Bruschi, Joseph Zaso, and Charlotte Roche. Joseph Zaso can also be seen in Nikos the Impaler.
Seven Girlfriends is a 1999 romantic comedy film starring Tim Daly. Daly can also be seen in The Fugitive.
The Cameo of the Yellowstone is a 1914 American silent short Western directed by Sidney Ayres starring William Garwood and Harry De Vere. Garwood also featured in the film The Kiss of Hate.
Ace of the Saddle is a 1919 American western film directed by John Ford and featuring Harry Carey. The film is considered to be lost. Fans of Carey might also enjoy his performance in Mr. Wu.
Gunfight at Comanche Creek is a 1963 Western film starring Audie Murphy. Another film to feature Murphy is The Quiet American.
I Sing of a Well is a 2009 Ghanaian film directed by Leila Djansi. It stars Jimmy Jean-Louis, Jot Agyeman and Freeman Ekow. Jean-Louis plays a significant role in the film Tears of the Sun.
The Whip Hand is a 1951 American film directed by William Cameron Menzies. It stars Carla Balenda and Elliott Reid. Reid also features in The Absent-Minded Professor.

Sarvakalasala [University] is a 1987 comedy/drama/romance Malayalam film directed by Venu Nagavalli, starring Mohanlal, Jagathi Sreekumar, Sukumaran, Adoor Bhasi, and Seema. You would also enjoy the film His Highness Abdullah starring Mohanlal.
The Railroad Man (Italian: Il Ferroviere) is a 1956 Italian drama film directed by Pietro Germi. Germi also directed and featured in Divorce Italian Style.
Stolen Assignment is a 1955 British comedy film directed by Terence Fisher. It stars John Bentley and Hy Hazell. Fans of Bentley might also enjoy his performance in Undercover Agent.
All Aboard is a 1917 American short comedy film starring Harold Lloyd. Lloyd also played a significant role in Safety Last!.

£500 Reward is a 1918 Australian silent film starring, written, produced, financed and directed by Claude Flemming who later described it as "a very lurid melodrama". Fleming also directed and starred in The Lost Dream.
Gunpoint is a 1966 American Western film starring Audie Murphy. Murphy also played a significant role in To Hell and Back.

Gone in the Night is a 1996 American television movie about the Jaclyn Dowaliby murder case, with Shannen Doherty and Kevin Dillon as Cynthia and David Dowaliby. Doherty is also known for her role in the series Charmed.

The Incredible Sarah is a 1976 British drama film directed by Richard Fleischer and starring Glenda Jackson. It presents a dramatization of the acting career of Sarah Bernhardt. Jackson also appeared in the film Women in Love.

In the 1976 British drama film The Incredible Sarah, directed by Richard Fleischer, celebrated actress Glenda Jackson portrayed the legendary actress Sarah Bernhardt. Jacksons stunning performance painted a vivid image of Bernhardts dramatic acting career. Jackson is also known for her acclaimed role in Elizabeth R
